abstract: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and Comptroller John C. Liu are seeking returns for the pension plans of New York City employees that are closer to those reported by Harvard and Yale.
snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and Comptroller John C. Liu are seeking returns for the pension plans of New York City employees that are closer to those reported by Harvard and Yale.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and New York's comptroller, John C. Liu, should perhaps call their ambitious plan to revamp the city's five public-employee retirement funds "No Pension Plan Left Behind."

headline.main: Behind New York's Pension Changes, a Quest for Higher Returns
